comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Woodrow Wilson was Governor (i.e. "Gov" ) of New Jersey before he was elected president in 1912. Was he also "Coy", as in "shy, demure, or devious",??? well perhaps... Ellen Axson Wilson was Wilson's first wife (until her death). en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ellen_Axson_Wilson Gov. William Hodges Mann of Virginia was actually a Confederate soldier earlier in his life. He was governor at the same time as Wilson. Here is a link to Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Hodges_Mann

comment.author: 42264328@N00
comment._content:
Henry, that is brilliant--I was wondering why President Wilson was not figured in the caption--because he was Gov Wilson at that time. Brilliant!

Note, too, the caption says "Mrs. & Gov Mann". Governor Mann of Virginia is the figure with the white beard on the right.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks, it certainly appears that the first word should be transcribed as "Gov."  We'll correct the source data and reload the description.
